Job Title: Project Coordinator, Civics and History Content
Job Description:
The Content Project Coordinator will work with the Education Content team and be responsible for the day-to-day management of content projects. This will encompass content development, quality assurance, vendor management, and reporting.
What makes you perfect for this position?
- You obsess over details.
- You consider deadlines to be absolute and not suggestions.
- You understand how to diplomatically hold the team to the project schedule no matter their level at the organization.
- You are a kind and confident person.
- You are comfortable championing your ideas and proud of your team's accomplishments
Responsibilities:

 Coordinate day-to-day curricular production, supporting the development and production of K-12 resources and materials, including:
 Overseeing the development and execution of project timelines.
 Identifying project priorities and supporting team members in meeting project milestones
 Managing all content through vetting and quality processes, ensuring all content is academically sound, accurate, and properly cited.
 Ensuring all appropriate rights and licenses are acquired and documented.
 Maintaining file and naming systems. Writing, and editing as needed.
 Assist Engagement in the coordination of timelines and final publication.

Qualifications:

 Must live in an urban area in the Pacific Northwest. Preference given to those living in the state of Washington and near a major airport.
 Bachelor's degree in education or related field (Master's degree preferred).
 Experience as a classroom teacher or in the education field. Preference given to those with experience in charter, private, or classical schools.
 Proven experience in cultivating and managing relationships with school districts, educators, and educational organizations.
 Strong business development skills, with a track record of identifying and pursuing educational partnership opportunities. Preference given to those with experience in developing fee-for-service work and/or a background in fundraising.
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage diverse stakeholders.
 Knowledge of educational trends, curriculum standards, and pedagogical strategies in social studies education preferred.
 Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of juggling multiple priorities and deadlines effectively.
 A willingness to travel frequently and work flexible hours as needed to fulfill the demands of the role.
 Deep commitment to constitutional principles and robust civic education.

If you are enthusiastic about supporting excellent civic education and are eager to play a pivotal role in advancing civic education by supporting educators, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in empowering educators and students with the resources they need to become informed and engaged citizens.
